fields.description:
Hi,

We use the TASK BOARD for our daily stand up meeting. In that meeting screen real estate is very important, we want to be able to see as many issues as possible. As such we would like a view that does excludes anything above the version drop down box line and anything below the columns ("Powered by ..." etc)

Anything else that also increases the value of the available screen space by allowing more issues to be seen also falls under this screen, so this includes [List mode in TASK BOARD|GHS-456] for example. Other ideas include:

* Compact the space between adjacent cards.
* Reduce the minimum card height for a given row of cards based on how much summary text they have. (i.e. don't include unnecessary vertical white space in the cards)

Thanks,

Ximon
fields.summary: "Full Screen" TASK BOARD view

fields.description: We've found a problem in GreenHopper where if I am looking at the task board with the fix version context set to a master fix version (e.g. fix version "Milestone 1" that has child fix versions "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2") and I click and drag an issue from "TO DO" to "IN PROGRESS", my context switches from "Milestone 1" to whichever child version the issue I moved belongs to (e.g. "Sprint 2").  This behaviour seems strange as I would expect my context to remain the same when I click and drag issues on the task board.  It is confusing to see issues disappear all of a sudden when I move an unrelated issue into a different column.

fields.description:
Right now the page numbers in the planning and task board are only at the top of the page.  So if you scroll down to the bottom of a page to look at the last issue shown, and then want to go the next page, you need to scroll to the top of the page to click the page number.  This is especially annoying when re-ranking new issues that arrive at the bottom of your backlog.

By also having the page number links at the bottom of the page I can quickly click to move to the next page, or quickly drag an item from the bottom of the last page to a new page number without scrolling or dragging the issue all the way to the top of the page.

Hopefully a really simple fix that will be a big time saver :)
fields.summary: Page #s should be at the top and bottom of page to speed moving issues between pages

fields.description:
Currently the GH burndown chart does not show the stories added or removed after the initial plan.  So if a sprint starts with several issues that comprise 16 story points (their committment), and then halfway into the sprint, the team decides to add 1 issue w/4 story points from the backlog, GH will redraw the graph in a way that shows the original committment as 20 story points, which actually the graph should reflect that 4 story points were added 1/2 way into the sprint.  

This is misleading because id a team took on more they should get more credit for it or it can be used to help understand "why did our plan change" 

Jeff Sutherland showed us how to do this in Scrum (which is also how some google teams do it) by showing a "Change in Committment" line to the story point Burndown chart.  The Committement line stays at 0 if there are no changes, but goes down (into negative territory) if story points get added, and goes up if story points are dropped.  GH would no longer redraw graphs with the line moving from 16 story points at the beginning to 20 points at the beginning if 4 points were added - rather GH would just draw the graph starting from the 16 points all the way down to -4 points.  This keeps the ideal line intact as well as the original committment.  See the I attached.
fields.summary: Add a "Change in Committment" line to story point Burndown chart to show a change in committment (adds/drops)

fields.description:
Like many product owners, I need to see my backlog of work (bugs, stories, etc) prioritized from top to bottom for all unreleased versions.  I can't plan future releases by puttingt them into Jira versions because if I do, there is no way to see a single top to bottom rank across all unreleased versions in the GH planning board (you can only see the items within a particular version or parent version and the ranking across versions is not clear).  

The only way to do that today it seems is to have *all* backlog items assigned to the *unscheduled* version until they are committed to a sprint (in which case the team uses the planning board to drag as many items as they can from the top of the ranked *unscheduled* version to the appropriate version/sprint. 

Then in the planning board, shown in list view (which is wonderful!), what I do is create tasks that say "Items shown above this task are for Version 1.5" and farther down on the ranked list I create a task that says "Items shown above this task are for Version 2.0" , etc.  When I want to plan releases to another I simply drag one item higher or lower to than the special "Version tasks" in the ranking.  Another benefit is that I create a task that says "Items shown below this task have to be reviewed" to allow me to see at a glance all items that have come in that I need to consider dragging to a higher rank.

What I'd like to see instead is that for every Jira unrelease version, that Greenhopper's planning board shows an item that represents the Jira unreleased version (e.g. Version 1.5) - so that I don't need to create the tasks that I described above.  With that I can see a top to bottom ranking, and by dragging an item above or below a Jira version item, I will be automatically setting the Jira Fix Version/s field.  This would be wonderful.  Items assigned to versions would not disspear from the view like they do now and I could see all items in 1 ranked view.  This would ALSO unifiy the rank field with the Fix Version/s field, which is great, since by definition, items in 1 earlier version should have a lower rank than items planned for later versions.

Make sense?  BTW doing this would basically simulate www.ScrumWorks.com planning board, which i think is one of the best ones around....also it would simulate the best practices for maintaining product backlogs in a single spreadsheet ala what Scrum creators like Jeff Sutherland reccomend.
fields.summary: Better support for planning a Backlog ranked from top to bottom

fields.description:
If I arrange my versions so that I have a release master version and a sprint child version when I drag a card on the planning board from the release to the sprint the card reappears in the release (because it now has two fix versions, the master and the child).

If I have several sprints and I just want to view the issues assigned to the release but not yet assigned to a sprint I don't appear to be able to because I can't find a way to highlight, filter or order by the fix version.

Quite frustrating and confusing.

fields.description:
Greenhoppers custom rank field is read-only in JIRA.  

It would be great if there was some renderer for that field in Jira, so while editing an issue in Jira, I could click a button next to the rank, and enter or select a different item to move the rank next to and also select if the item shoud be moved "before" or "after" the selected item.  

e.g. if my items and ranks were 

A with rank 1
B  with rank 2
C with rank 3

And I was editing Item A in JIRA, I could click a button see a dialog box, and select item C and indicate "after" and that would cause A to be moved after C in rank as follows.  

B  with rank 1
C with rank 2
A with rank 3
fields.summary: Allow changing greenhopper ranks in JIRA with a JIRA renderer

fields.description:
Today I need to do this awkard process after selecting one or more issues to move across pages
1) drag them over a page number (which page number I should drag to is a guess since I can't see what I am dragging to)
2) after I drop on the page, watch the page number switch
3) find the issues at the bottom.  Or repeat steps #1-3 if I got the page # wrong.
4) select drag and drop them to the right spot on the page - if that spot on the page is off-screen I need to drop and then scroll my window and repeat step 4.

*Instead I'd prefer to do it in 1 drag step like MS Word allows for dragging text.* 
e.g. When I hover over a page number on a drag operation, switch to the target page BEFORE I drop, then I can drop exactly where I want.  Also when I drag items outside of the visible scrolling area of the page, the browser window should auto-scroll up / down depending on where my cursor is so I can drag and drop exactly where I want to.    This is just like what happens with MS Word and dragging some selected text.   As I drag outside the window, the window scrolls in the direction of my dragging.  And If I drag the text over a minimized window app in the task bar, the windows app opens to accept the text I am dragging so I can drop it there.  Greenhopper pages would operate like windows apps in this case, opening as I dragged over each page.

Another less elegant (but equally fast) option would be to have a modal "Move" button.  I select the items to Rank, click Move, and then find the page I want (by clicking on each page - no dragging), and then when found I click on the item that I want to move the items next to.  Like I said not as elegant, but faster and less error prone than how it is now :)
